description:
Just once again a weekday evening hike: This time from Spandau to Hennigsdorf, along the Havel river.

We'll start at Spandau, walk through the historic "Kolk", cross the Island "Eiswerder" (with a nice view of the Citadel), pass by the "Bürgerablage" beach, go along the "Berliner Mauerweg" and pass by an old east German watchtower, while going mostly along the Havel river which is partially quite wide in this area.

We'll meet on Wednesday at 6:30 PM at the subway station Altstadt Spandau. (Not S+U Spandau - that is one stop away from the meeting point).

The hike will be about 16 km long. We should reach Hennigsdorf roughly at 9:45 PM - just at dawn.

From Hennigsdorf, we can use the S25 to get back to Berlin. Note that Hennigsdorf is in the C-Area, so you need ABC tickets.

Note:

* Please be on time at the meeting point.
* There probably won't be too many Späties along the route, so better bring some water and food with you.
* You are all responsible for yourself.
* It is planned to arrive just briefly after sunset at Hennigsdorf. Still, just in case, or if you want to extend the walk on your own, bring a flashlight with you.
how_to_find_us: In front of the subway station exit at Carl-Schurtz-Straße
name: After-Work Hike: Spandau to Hennigsdorf (16 km)

description:
Are you New in Berlin?
TheWednesday! is an international meetup, where people form all over the world get together to enjoy a nice evening.
+++You can speak ENGLISH.
+++Se habla espanol.
+++Du kannst auch in deutsch sprechen.
+++all languages are welcome.

We meet every week and more often you come, then more friends you make.
Simple concept: "Same day, same time, same location"

Our DJ creates always with his beats the right atmosphere.
DON'T MISS IT. IT'S YOU WHO MAKE IT HAPPEN...

(Argentina, Spain, Turkey, Germany, France, USA, Latvia, Russia, Finland and many more...)

Celebrate the middle of week!!! This meet-up is supported by paparazzi Berlin

Call THE WEDNESDAY an after-work-party...
Call THE WEDNESDAY a Language party...

https://www.facebook.com/groups/thewednesday.berlin/

We want to have a great evening together with regulars and new-comers exchanging ideas, experiences and more....

venue.address_1: Heidebrinker Str.1, 13357 Berlin ( Next to Gesundbrunnen Shopping Center), Berlin
venue.name: Dhyana Centre

description:
This is a beautiful evening session called Simirthi Sitting which is open to everyone who is interested in personal growth. No previous experience is required, you are invited to explore.
Simirthi is a Sanskrit word that means - self remembrance. It is a process of sitting in rest and remembering one's self. A quorum is set for people to come together for themselves, by themselves. The evening is guided by a facilitator, who will introduce you to the simirthi, there will be a breathing exercise, an insightful talk and two sittings of 20 min each.
If you can, bring a shawl to wrap yourself with.
Should you have any questions, do not hesitate to ask. :)

Please bring a shawl to wrap yourself with.

Heidebrinkerstrasse 1 is easy to be found in the inner yard, just behind the corner of Heidebrinkerstrasse 3. Ring at Pillay and come to the roof apartment :)
name: Evening meditation - Simirthi sitting

description:
Think you’re funny? Prove it!

Because at Joke Time, Berlin’s English comedy open mic for beginners, we’re about one thing and one thing only: Jokes.

Just turn up the Comedy Café Berlin by 8.30pm if you want to perform. You’ll get 4 to 6 minutes, depending on your experience level and how many acts sign up. After your set, you’ll get a free beer or soft drink! Bring some friends to support you. Tell them the show is free/donation-based if they need convincing which they shouldn’t, because this is your dream goddammit!

As an audience member at Joke Time, you’ll get to see some of the hottest, rawest, funniest standup Berlin has to offer! Experienced comics come around all the time to try out new material, so don’t worry, it’s not just noobs on stage.
____________________________________________

I’m your host Toby Arsalan and I’ll be making sure the night stays fun and entertaining, even when the acts are not. I’ve toured abroad and organise other shows like Flat Earth Comedy and Monday Night Mics here in Berlin. Here is me in action:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ul4yIPyni2w
____________________________________________

JOKE TIME! BERLIN’S BIG FAT ENGLISH STANDUP COMEDY OPEN MIC

8.30pm | Wednesdays | Comedy Café Berlin
Roseggerstraße 17 | 12059 Neukölln

Like I said, the show is FREE, but a 5€ donation is suggested.

Interested in taking comedy classes? Check out comedycafeberlin.com/courses
____________________________________________

For more infos and other comedy shows in Berlin, check out these links:

https://www.facebook.com/toby.arsalan/events/
http://tobyarsalan.com/
http://comedycafeberlin.com/
http://comedyinenglish.de/
name: Get on stage & do a 5 min Stand-Up Set at Joke Time!

venue.name: Meet in front of KaffeeRaum Berlin

description:
Want to meet us and discuss data-driven marketing? Online analytics? Or maybe data science?

Join us over coffee in KaffeeRaum Berlin for a private chat.

We'll be there 3PM-5PM on Thursday.

Previously we hosted this meetup as "office hours" (see the picture above), but offices are boring, so we turned it into "COFFEE HOURS".

But chat topics are still serious! You'll find some ideas below.

- STRATEGY

• Setup of the marketing strategy.

• Marketing & analytics plan for mobile/B2C/B2B/platform verticals.

• Key metrics along the 5 stages of marketing funnel (awareness, acquisition, behavior, conversion, profitability).

- ANALYTICS

• Implementations of analytical and marketing tools, e.g. Segment, Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Tableau, E-commerce and enhanced e-commerce tracking, Google Big Query, Optimize, and other, as well as Mailchimp, Drip, Drift, Zapier, and other.

• Integrations between the tools.

- CAMPAIGNS

• Optimisation of marketing channels, e.g. website, Facebook fanpage and campaigns, landing pages, Adwords, DoubleClick etc.

• Creating an optimal marketing mix.

• Conversion optimisation.

- DATA SCIENCE

• Warehousing of marketing data. Data pipelines.

• Big Data analytics for marketing.

• Machine learning algorithms depending on the marketing use case.

• Model development and training.

Just RSVP here and we'll get in touch with you via private message to confirm the exact meeting time.

See you there!
name: ☕COFFEE HOURS: Grab a coffee with us and discuss data-driven marketing!

description:
Speakers/panel guests/hosts Tom Weckström, Ashwin Rajan (to be confirmed), Antti Suvanto. Marjukka Niinioja

• What we'll do
Voted in the top 5 "hot potatoes" of this years meetups:
How do you plan and manage your roadmap?

Passionate topic we didn't have time to finish last year:
How is product development started? How do you decide features? How do you ensure they are what the customers will actually value and buy? Do you use canvases or other ways to do this? If yes, what is your favorite?

We'll have a panel discussion and maybe even some presentations. Let us know if you are interested to be in a panel or suggest someone

• What to bring
You can bring your own roadmaps, canvases, lots of questions and enthusiastic spirit
name: Canvas Wars and Product Roadmaps - planning your product development

description:
Join us on this free workshop on creating automated, eye candy workshops and visualisations for marketers, in particular marketing managers.

WORKSHOP GOALS

● Understand why telling stories via visuals will be the critical sales & marketing skill in the future.

● Be able to craft visual messages that take full advantage of the human processing abilities for greater retention of your message.

● Understand the limits & problems of data visualizations and ways to counteract them.

● Be able to reap important business insights on your own by learning to create both simple and advanced data visualizations and dashboards.

● Be able to make better decisions by creating interactive dashboards based on your business KPIs.

WHAT YOU GET

● Exclusive e-mail invitation (PDF)
● Networking & chat with data experts
● Named seat
● Workshop materials
● Post-meetup dashboarding consulting

MOTIVATION

Google "data visualization" and here are the headlines that pop up:

- Tech hotshots: The rise of the dataviz expert. [ComputerWorld]
- The next big thing in 'big data' jobs: Dataviz [Fortune]
- Important job roles in data science industry today [Analytics Vidhya]
- Data visualization is the future - Here's Why [Forbes]

It goes on and on and on ...

Why do you think the world needs so many data visualization experts?

44 000 000 000 000 000 000 000B

That's 44 zetabytes.

That's exactly how much data will be here by 2020.

We're drowning in data.

And this is why we need marketers, who are also dataviz ninjas.

For data­-savvy marketers, in particular marketing managers, it means that it’s getting harder to make good data­-driven decisions. Too much noise. The amount of error you can potentially make misusing or misinterpreting data is just enormous.

IDEAL AUDIENCE

● Marketers, in particular marketing managers, who want to tell amazing stories with data for improved retention, conversions and increased customer lifetime value, and uncover trends that may not be apparent on the first sign.

STYLE

It's going to be a hands-on workshop. Bring your own computer.

Expect an interactive experience with a ton of insights, peer work, trial & error, sketching, discussions, and working with modern tools like Google Data Studio.

AGENDA

17:30 - 18:15 - Workshop, part 1
18:15 - 18:35 - Break
18:35 - 19:30 - Workshop, part 2

TOOLS & TECHNOLOGIES

The key technology we'll explore in this workshop is Google Data Studio.

PRICE

This workshop is free.

RULES & NEXT STEPS

● RSVP here
● Wait for the confirmation over private message via Meetup. RSVP does not mean you'll automatically take part in the workshop.
● Wait for named e-mail invitation for reserved seat.
● Come 5 minutes before the event. Bring your invitation (no need to print it, just have it in your e-mail).

NO-SHOW POLICY

Our standard policy in the entire, 1400+ member, international community based in 6 cities is that no-shows are banned from participating in two consecutive meetups / workshops. Please: only serious RSVPs.

Join us!
name: Workshop: Create beautiful & automated marketing dashboards

description:
THIS IS A FREE EVENT - PLEASE FINISH YOUR RSVP IN THE LINK BELOW
https://events.mobilegrowth.org/events/details/branch-berlin-presents-mobile-growth-berlin-w-babbel-branch-jodel-takeaway-wysker-yeay-samsung-next

Join us for our quarterly meetup for a night of growth stories and strategies from mobile experts from top performing apps in the city. We’ll kick off the evening with some beer, soft drinks, and pizza, and then hear lessons and best practices for app growth. We’ll cover everything from organic and paid user acquisition, retention and engagement strategies, and more.

Agenda
6:30 pm: Networking and Food
7:00 pm: Welcome and Introductions
7:15 pm: Mobile Growth Panel
8:00 pm: Q&A from audience
8:15 pm: Wrap-up & more social time

---

Speaker
Mike Molinet - Branch (COO & Co-founder)
Mike is the COO and co-founder of Branch, a deep linking, and mobile metrics company. Prior to Branch, Mike spent 5 years in product development for 3M, where he launched over a dozen products and acquired 10 patents. He holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering from Bucknell and an MBA from Stanford University.

Panelists
Jegor Ivanov - Jodel (Growth Product Manager)
Jegor Ivanov works as the Growth Product Manager at Jodel. His past experience includes online marketing at Rocket Internet, Crowd Mobile, and most recently, mobile CRM at 8fit. With over six years of experience across five countries, he is a startup aficionado with expertise in e-commerce in emerging markets, health & fitness and entertainment verticals

Kirill Petrovsky - Babbel (Principal Marketing Platforms Manager)
Kirill Petrovsky works as the Principal Marketing Platforms Manager at Babbel, a subscription-based language e-learning platform. With over 10 years of experience in building cutting-edge products that lie at the intersection of marketing, technology, and business goals, he’s an expert at AdTech and performance marketing workflows.

Melanie Mohr - YEAY (CEO)
Melanie Mohr is a Berlin-based entrepreneur with 20 years’ experience producing videos. In 2016 she founded YEAY - the leading video m-commerce platform providing GenZ with a space to share and shop. In 2018 she became the founder and CEO of WOM Token Ltd., the blockchain company helping brands tap into peer-2-peer recommendations.

Selçuk Karpuz - Takeaway (Product Owner)
Selçuk currently works as the Product Owner of Takeaway.com, the leading food-ordering site in continental Europe. His experience of over 4 years has been focused on Product Management in the e-commerce industry, where he has worked on the technical aspects of Growth, CRM and Analytics projects for Marketing Departments. Prior to Takeaway.com, he worked with Trendyol Group in Turkey.

Tobias Haag - Wysker (Founder/CEO)
Tobias is the founder and CEO of Wysker, a crypto-powered shopping app that introduces hyperspeed discovery. He initiated Germany's first ICO collecting more than 2.5m EUR in 2017/18.

Moderator
Karolina Attspodina - Branch (Growth Lead)

Hosted By
Elizabeth Kinsey, Community + Events
Community, events, and marketing professional accomplished in managing on and offline marketing programs and campaigns. Experienced moderator and speaker. Specializes in inbound lead generation, live events and webinars, community building, product initiatives, email marketing, social media marketing, content creation, and lead nurturing programs. Love cats, memes, popcorn, sci-fi, and The Joy of Painting.

Anjali Kumar, Evangelist
All things mobile, growth, and community!

Vikram Prakash, Account Executive - Europe

---

Global Partner
Branch (https://branch.io)
Branch provides solutions that unify user measurement across different devices, platforms, and channels, delivering a seamless customer experience no matter where the user comes from. Today's mobile businesses are divided, causing inaccurate attribution and links that don’t work, leading to wasted marketing spend and broken customer journeys. Branch fixes that - providing a holistic view of various user touch points, ensuring that links take the user to the right place on website or native app.

Venue Host
Spielfeld Digital Hub GmbH (http://www.spielfeld.com/)
Spielfeld Digital Hub is a best-in class innovation hub for corporates and startups. We offer co-working spaces, an exclusive community of innovators & makers and engaging event & workshop formats to support the digital transformation of corporates and encourage cross-industry collaboration. Spielfeld was founded by Roland Berger & Visa Inc. which gives us access to a broad range of industry expertise enabling us to help those pass through our doors to win the game of digital transformation.

Partner
Samsung NEXT (http://samsungnext.com/)
Samsung NEXT Berlin targets early-stage startups with a focus on fast scaling technologies, such as artificial intelligence, Internet of Things, augmented reality and virtual reality. The investment & M&A arm will partner with Europe’s most exciting startups to grow their businesses and will leverage its significant global scale to provide startups with capital, resources, expertise and deep connections within Samsung’s ecosystem.

---

THIS IS A FREE EVENT - PLEASE FINISH YOUR RSVP IN THE LINK BELOW
https://events.mobilegrowth.org/events/details/branch-berlin-presents-mobile-growth-berlin-w-babbel-branch-jodel-takeaway-wysker-yeay-samsung-next
name: MG Berlin w/ Babbel, Branch, Jodel, Takeaway, Wysker, YEAY & Samsung NEXT

description:
A soft yet intense 90 min class designed to give special attention to our breath which is used to clear the tensions we hold in the body. It moves the energy in our being thus removing the energetic blockages and re-establishing the natural softness.

This is still held as a donation based class, it is held in English and is open to everyone.

Heidebrinker strasse 1 is easy to be accessed through the inner yard, just behind the corner of Heidebrinker strasse 3. Ring at Pillay/Dhyana Centre and come to the roof apartment. Looking forward to meeting you.
name: Gentle flow yoga class

description:
Once a month, on a Friday or Saturday you can catch Toby Arsalan & his comedian friends for a night of quality standup comedy at the cosy 800A in Wedding – the Neukölln of North Berlin! They’ll talk about life and love spreading jokes, joy and laughter along the way...

BUY TICKETS AT: http://wonthamonth.com/

Every line-up at Wonth-A-Month will feature two of the funniest local talents available for booking on short notice. There will also be TWO OPEN MIC SPOTS highlighting some new faces on the scene. Just post in the FB Event to ask for a spot (preference given to women, POC and LGBTQA_).

For quality assurance purposes, this is an English language standup comedy show. No German Skills (or German Sense of Humour) Required!

Certified Better Than Crying Yourself To Sleep At Night™!
__________________

Saturday, May 26
Host: Toby Arsalan
Lineup: Marne Litfin (USA) • Daniel Louis Vezza (USA)

800A • Stettiner Straße 19, 13357 Berlin
U Pankstraße (U8) / Gesundbrunnen (U8/Ring)

Doors 8.30pm • Show 9pm • Entry: Six Euros (5 if you book online!)
__________________

Links:
tobyarsalan.com
comedyinenglish.de

BUY TICKETS AT: http://wonthamonth.com/
name: Wonth-A-Month! Stand-Up Comedy, Once A Month

description:
It's Comedy. On a Boat. On the Spree.

Laughing Spree Comedy is a weekly comedy show with an extremely friendly atmosphere and some of Berlin's finest comedians, lots of guest comedians and the occasional first timer. And it's all for free, including compulsory free shots! Also, anyone who feels up for the challenge may join us for Karaoke after the show.

• When? Every Monday
• Where? The Floating Lounge
• When again? Doors open at 8pm, Show starts 9pm

Free compulsory shots before the show starts. RSVP here (we reserve seats till 8.45pm). Come on down to the boat at 8pm for some pre-show drinks with the host and the other meetupers and let's get to know each other some more.

Each Comedian has 5-7 minutes to make you laugh.

See you buoys and gulls aboard. Keep on laughing!
name: Laughing Spree -  Free Entry English Comedy Show with Free Shots

description:
Come finish off the first and worst work day of the week at Berlin's second funniest comedy open mic!

Monday Night Mics welcomes comedians of any skill and age. Swing by Kleinod Bar every Monday to see these brave souls work out their material in front of you. For free!

Because founder Daniel Louis Vezza is chasing his dreams in New York until April, Toby Arsalan has enlisted a veritable who’s who of Berlin’s funniest comedians to guest host with him.

Please check out our Facebook page, join the event there and write on the wall if you are interested in performing. 6 to 8 Minutes per act, 7 to 10 slots available. We usually post the lineup on Saturday.

Door 20:30
Show 21:00

5€ suggested donation
NO GERMAN SKILLS REQUIRED

LINKS:
https://www.facebook.com/mondaynightmicsberlin/
https://www.facebook.com/toby.arsalan/events/
https://tobyarsalan.com
comedyinenglish.de
name: Monday Night Mics • Berlin's 2nd Funniest Standup Comedy Open Mic

description:
"The most cost-effective safeguards you can implement today, to prepare your company for risks of the future."

Dawid Bałut, Director of Offensive Security at TestArmy Group, oriented on creating highly skilled and productive security team capable of helping all types of businesses improve their safety.
For the past 6 years worked as a Enterprise Security Architect, becoming a pioneer of DevSecOps movement implementing cost-effective solutions meant to protect products built by a Silicon Valley-based security company.
Also a published author by medias such as Forbes, Apple News, Quora and Egnyte.

"GDPR - risks for personal data protection: marketing SaaS & cloud services."

Joanna Mamczur, LL.M. Finance, MBA, attorney-at-law and GDPR expert with over 12 years of international experience in business advisory services, working with multimillion corporate clients, financial institutions as well as SMEs and startups on high-volume Banking & Finance and M&A transactions.
She has been a frequent speaker at conferences and trainings on GDPR/personal data protection, including major events in IT for security experts and medical sectors.
name: The most safeguards you can implement today, to prepare for risks of the future

description:
PLEASE REGISTER HERE:
https://www.meetup.com/de-DE/GOTO-Nights-Berlin/events/251198051/?eventId=251198051&rv=ea1&rv=ea1

Doors opening 18:30
Start 19:00
Cost free of charge

Snacks & refreshments included
Speaker Thijs Schreijer

GOTO Night: Microservices and API gateways

With the increasing maturity of container technology and orchestration tools like Kubernetes, transitioning from legacy monolithic applications to microservices is becoming more accessible to teams and organizations around the world. API gateways play an important role in this, and based on experience with enterprise organizations and developers who have pursued the transition we will be looking at different strategies, patterns and pitfalls.

Bio: Thijs Schreijer has been working in IT for almost 25 years. He had many different roles from management consultant to service manager to software engineer, in just as many disciplines, infrastructure, outsourcing, testing and software development. He joined the startup Kong Inc in 2015 and is currently holding the position of Solutions Architect in the Office of the CTO at Kong Inc where he helps clients in making the transition to microservices.

Twitter: @thekonginc, @thijsschreijer
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/thijsschreijer/
Website: http://getkong.org

PS: We will once again raffle one conference ticket for GOTO Berlin 2018 ! ;)
name: GOTO Night: Microservices and API gateways

description:
What weird stuff do YOU believe?

Toby Arsalan is determined to find out. At Berlin's first and only all crowd-work comedy show. Every Tuesday in the cool basement of It's a BAR in the heart of Kreuzberg.

Entry 5€. No German skills required.

Get last minute tickets at the door or even better, book online:
http://buytickets.at/tobyarsalan

______________________________

Reviews:

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

"One of the hottest stand-ups in town!"
— COMEDY CAFÉ BERLIN

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

"The funniest German-Pakistani ever!"
— GOLIATH COMEDY JOHANNESBURG

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

"Hilarious!"
— CAPE TOWN COMEDY CLUB

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

"my face was all the time smiling. he have a very good quality of flow and timing that not many comedian have. he connect the jokes very well and is very graceful. i certainly recommend this show. and i am grateful to learn about the connection of siriyan people and titanic. go see it is great"
— ELINOR, AUDIENCE MEMBER AT EDINBURGH FRINGE

______________________________

More about Toby Arsalan:

Toby Arsalan is a German-Pakistani standup comedian writing, performing and procrastinating in Berlin. You may know him from his 2017 solo at the Edinburgh Fringe (titled "Nazi Jihadi") or form one of the many gigs he's played and hosted in places as diverse as Germany, Spain, Finland, Zambia & South Africa.

http://tobyarsalan.com/
https://www.facebook.com/toby.arsalan/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ul4yIPyni2w

Always on the lookout for a new Hitler joke, or a new dick jock - or, ideally, a Hitler dick joke, Nir and Chris are crushin' it.

It's a FREE entry comedy show in English with loads of fun and FREE SHOTS upon entry!

Doors at 9pm and Show starts at 9.30pm, bring your funny bones!

description:
12min.me (http://12min.me/) Berlin invites you again to an evening of insight exchange and the easiest networking in town.

Three great speakers offer their stories, insights and learnings but they don´t have much time. Because everything runs at a 12min.-Beat:

12minutes talk
12minutes Q&A
12minutes networking

The evenings usually end with free drinks, great conversations and new friends.
And the best thing ist: Everything is for free.

Come along, get inspired, enjoy networking!

________________________________________________________________________

name: 12min.me - Ignite Talks & Networking #28

description:
* Python Meetup at co.up
** Timetable
- 19:00 setting up
- 19:10 introductions
- 19:15 Python Metaprogramming - Csaba Tamas
- 19:45 Topic 2
- 20:15 Lightning Talks
- 20:35 closing down
- 20:45 Restaurant

** Python Metaprogramming
programming can be seen as the task to transform data. But soon you realize that you might also run some code to change the code itself, in a way that you can banish boilerplate from your life. This revelation opens up a whole new world of possibilities, where you're free to focus only on the fun parts, delivering business value from day one.
That is the reason I started to write Appkernel (https://github.com/accelero-cloud/appkernel), a beautiful and opninionated python framework “for humans”, helping to deliver REST enabled micro-services from zero to production within minutes (no kidding: literally within minutes). I'd be happy to share some of the experiences with you.

** Topic 2
Topic(s) not fixed yet. Please feel free to make suggestions to the organizers!

** Lightning Talks
A lightning talk is a presentation shorter than 10 minutes.
Keep it brief and concise with a lot of slides and code.

** Restaurant
At about 8:45 pm we'll move to a nearby Thai restaurant.
https://www.google.com/maps/place/Chaapa+Viet+%26+Thai+-+in+Berlin+Kreuzberg+f%C3%BCr+original+thail%C3%A4ndische+und+vietnamesische+K%C3%BCche/@52.5006806,13.4189231,19z/data=!4m8!1m2!2m1!1sco.up!3m4!1s0x47a84e3382a9b541:0xc0136a115a7f3b17!8m2!3d52.5007937!4d13.4191071?hl=en
name: Python User Group Meeting

description:
Florian Hager founder of “Meinwerdung -Thrive Coaching” and organiser of the Meetup Group “Learning for Life” is the only German disciple trained and certified by Dr. John Grinder, the Creator of one of the most effective short-term therapies called NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) as a NLP classic code Trainer and NLP New Code Coach.
In his years of professional experience, Florian had the opportunity to assist Dr. John Grinder, Trainer of Tony Robbins, as a Co-Trainer.

Florian learned the newest approaches to Hypnosystemic Work under Dr. Steven Gilligan, the master student of Milton Erickson (master of Hypnotherapy) and Dr. Gunther Schmidt (Founder of Hypnosystemic Approach).

Meinwerdung stands for sustainable High-Performance & Florians credo is
“Performing on Peak and being fulfilled on a long run.” To achieve that for his clients he trains them to experience more Flow in their daily professional and non-professional life.

In this Introduction, you will experience first hand how to get into Flow-States as well as what stops you from getting there.
You will get practical tips and tricks for taking away and for self-application that will help you transform your life to get to the next level.
Remember a moment in your life when your mind was calm, no self-criticising voices, no limiting perfectionism, no worries or Ideas that held you back…
When you did what you were doing is absolutely absorbed and focused and it just felt good…This is what happens when you are in a Flow-State!
Now imagine you could have States likes this throughout your entire life in every aspect and every area.

-->
What will your life look like when you understand the messages from your intuition because your body and mind work together?
-->
How much energy would you safe when making decisions from your gut, rather than your mind.
-->
How would it be when you have the courage to follow your ideas and goals and become more proactive?
-->
When you stand up and do what you feel like doing, rather than questioning yourself and miss the next opportunity?

If you want to know the answer to these questions join us and find out for yourself!!
We look forward to seeing you there!
name: Flow – The Key to Sustainable High-Performance and Personal Fulfilment

group.name: Association of Trainers, Coaches and Consultants

venue.name: University of Applied Sciences Berlin - BiTS/BTK

description:
Hi everyone,

The aim of the meet up is to build up a solid VR/MR developer’s community. We help each other on developing our skills and projects.

If you are working on a VR/MR project or you plan to start one, join us.
Two Vives, two HoloLens, help on Unity3D / C# are available.

Seats are limited. To join, register and send me a message describing your project. (we are 10+ vr/mr devs meeting weekly but we can extend up to 20, then we ll arrange more equipment for you.)

(Bring your laptops, snack and drink)

See you Sat,
Carl White
how_to_find_us: When invited, you will get details where to find us
name: VRDB#32: coding VR/MR projects

description:
It's Comedy. On a Boat. On the Spree.

Laughing Spree Comedy is a weekly comedy show with an extremely friendly atmosphere and some of Berlin's finest comedians, lots of guest comedians and the occasional first timer. And it's all for free, including compulsory free shots! Also, anyone who feels up for the challenge may join us for Karaoke after the show.

• When? Every Monday
• Where? The Floating Lounge
• When again? Doors open at 8pm, Show starts 9pm

Free compulsory shots before the show starts. RSVP here (we reserve seats till 8.45pm). Come on down to the boat at 8pm for some pre-show drinks with the host and the other meetupers and let's get to know each other some more.

Each Comedian has 5-7 minutes to make you laugh.

See you buoys and gulls aboard. Keep on laughing!
name: Laughing Spree -  Free Entry English Comedy Show with Free Shots

description:
Come finish off the first and worst work day of the week at Berlin's second funniest comedy open mic!

Monday Night Mics welcomes comedians of any skill and age. Swing by Kleinod Bar every Monday to see these brave souls work out their material in front of you. For free!

Because founder Daniel Louis Vezza is chasing his dreams in New York until April, Toby Arsalan has enlisted a veritable who’s who of Berlin’s funniest comedians to guest host with him.

Please check out our Facebook page, join the event there and write on the wall if you are interested in performing. 6 to 8 Minutes per act, 7 to 10 slots available. We usually post the lineup on Saturday.

name: Flat Earth Comedy

description:
Update: We have to postpone the meetup as one of our speakers will not make it. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Dear Webtrekkers,

summer is here, and the roof-deck terrace is calling to us and we cannot help but answer the call with a good meetup. 20th of June we will welcome two speakers, who will give us some practical insights and tips on mobile analytics. We start again at 18:30 at the Webtrekk Headquarters, but this time please use the entry on Hannoversche Str. 19.

Our speakers are:

Ole Bahlmann, Product Manager for mobile at Webtrekk, will give you the scoop on customer journey attribution and what’s special when it comes to mobile analytics. He will address different attribution models, how misapplying them can hurt your business and what is important to keep in mind when thinking about your customer’s journey.

Next up we have Gerrit Rode from 360 Dialog, who will detail what he learned in practice and how important it is to work out a concept in advance to assemble the data required to enable all the modern marketing hooplahoop, especially personalized lifecycle communication across mobile channels. Gerrit will showcase his insights with relevant case studies to show what’s possible and what is required.

Food & Drinks
As always, we might not be the biggest meetup, but we strive to provide at least the best self-cooked peanut-butter-chili and fresh vegetable sticks with hummus. Softdrinks, water and beer are available.

One small request: do not worry about space, if you want to come, we have enough space available, so please do not RSVP to just save yourself a space for the slight possibility that you might come, but rather do so, when you are reasonably sure that you will come. That would make preparations so much easier.
how_to_find_us: Please use the entry on Hannoversche Str. 19 this time, right across from the Mensa. Follow the signs.
name: Mobile first – customer journey insights

description:
Are you New in Berlin?
TheWednesday! is an international meetup, where people form all over the world get together to enjoy a nice evening.
+++You can speak ENGLISH.
+++Se habla espanol.
+++Du kannst auch in deutsch sprechen.
+++all languages are welcome.

We meet every week and more often you come, then more friends you make.
Simple concept: "Same day, same time, same location"

Our DJ creates always with his beats the right atmosphere.
DON'T MISS IT. IT'S YOU WHO MAKE IT HAPPEN...

(Argentina, Spain, Turkey, Germany, France, USA, Latvia, Russia, Finland and many more...)

Celebrate the middle of week!!! This meet-up is supported by paparazzi Berlin

Call THE WEDNESDAY an after-work-party...
Call THE WEDNESDAY a Language party...
Call THE WEDNESDAY a get-together...
https://www.facebook.com/groups/thewednesday.berlin/

We want to have a great evening together with regulars and new-comers exchanging ideas, experiences and more....

Ask for the drink of the night! Could be an GIN&TONIC, PINA COLADA, etc.

The Lounge presents a nice atmosphere where you can have a pleasant evening.

Please register as well under:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/thewednesday.berlin/

This event is supported by simpleandfun (http://www.simple-and-fun.com).
name: International Language Meetup on the boat! DJ music, terrace

description:
Fokus des Treffens ist das Arbeiten an Nextcloud/ownCloud. Jeder kann mitmachen, ob Design, Programmierung, Übersetzung, Marketing oder Fehlersuche – also bringt eure Laptops mit! :)

Einige Server- und App-Entwickler sind vor Ort. Wir treffen uns jeden dritten Mittwoch im Monat.

Our focus will be on collaboratively improving Nextcloud/ownCloud. Design, programming, translation, finding bugs, spreading the word, etc – everyone who wants to get active is invited! Do not forget to bring your laptop :)

We meet every third Wednesday a month.

We often play with devices like Raspberry Pi and Banana Pi's, installing Nextcloud on them and testing. Bring your own stuff, if you want to have Nextcloud running on it!
how_to_find_us: We are easily found in the mainhall, just look for Nextcloud t-shirts & a poster.
name: Nextcloud Stammtisch/Hacktisch

description:
Think you’re funny? Prove it!

Because at Joke Time, Berlin’s English comedy open mic for beginners, we’re about one thing and one thing only: Jokes.

Just turn up the Comedy Café Berlin by 8.30pm if you want to perform. You’ll get 4 to 6 minutes, depending on your experience level and how many acts sign up. After your set, you’ll get a free beer or soft drink! Bring some friends to support you. Tell them the show is free/donation-based if they need convincing which they shouldn’t, because this is your dream goddammit!

As an audience member at Joke Time, you’ll get to see some of the hottest, rawest, funniest standup Berlin has to offer! Experienced comics come around all the time to try out new material, so don’t worry, it’s not just noobs on stage.
____________________________________________

I’m your host Toby Arsalan and I’ll be making sure the night stays fun and entertaining, even when the acts are not. I’ve toured abroad and organise other shows like Flat Earth Comedy and Monday Night Mics here in Berlin. Here is me in action:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ul4yIPyni2w
____________________________________________

JOKE TIME! BERLIN’S BIG FAT ENGLISH STANDUP COMEDY OPEN MIC

8.30pm | Wednesdays | Comedy Café Berlin
Roseggerstraße 17 | 12059 Neukölln

Like I said, the show is FREE, but a 5€ donation is suggested.

Interested in taking comedy classes? Check out comedycafeberlin.com/courses
____________________________________________

For more infos and other comedy shows in Berlin, check out these links:

https://www.facebook.com/toby.arsalan/events/
http://tobyarsalan.com/
http://comedycafeberlin.com/
http://comedyinenglish.de/
name: Get on stage & do a 5 min Stand-Up Set at Joke Time!

description:
About the meetup:

Please check berlinjs.org for up-to-date info about the talks we have scheduled for the upcoming event! If there's an open slot, consider making a pull-request to give a talk yourself, or encourage a friend to do the same :)

Please get in touch with any of the organizers with any questions you have. We welcome a diverse range of topics that are related in any way to JavaScript and the community around it. New speakers, experienced speakers, and everyone in between. If you have an idea you aren't sure about, just reach out.

Drinks can be purchased at 2 euro. There is a small selection of non-alcoholic beverages and beer to choose from.

Our Commitment to a Code of Conduct:

Our goal is to have an awesome, inclusive and safe community meetup where people meet, hang out together, chat, listen to talks, exchange ideas and make new friends. Any harmful or discriminating behavior will not be tolerated and results in the offending person being expelled from the meetup.

For details on what kinds of behavior are not tolerated and consequences for violating these rules, we refer to the Berlin Code of Conduct.

Keep in touch:

on twitter: @BerlinJS

on the web: berlinjs.org

on foursquare: Berlin.JS

Detailed Directions:

co.up is located closest to the Kottbusser Tor U-bahn station (U8 & U1).

Please note that there are two entrances to the hof where co.up is located. If one gate is closed, the other should be open.

If you're attending for the first time, check out the map below.


About our supporters:

We are so grateful to be hosted by the wonderful co.up coworking space each month at no cost. Therefore, we ask if you enjoy our meetups, please consider supporting co.up's generosity by helping fund upgrades and renovations with a small donation in the jar near the fridge.

If you need a coworking space, consider joining co.up!
how_to_find_us: Ring the bell for co.up 3rd floor, then come up to the 3rd floor.
name: Berlin.JS

description:
Women and femme coders will talk about more advanced topics in programming. We'll have three talks.

The agenda for the evening:

7:00 pm - Start: get yourself a drink and a snack
7:35 pm - Community Announcements

Talk 1 - Designers are from Mars, developers are from Venus, by Sonja Heinen
Talk 2 - Data (Science) in Physical Sciences, by Uğur Ural
Talk 3 - TBA

10pm - End of the meetup

About the talks:
*Designers are from Mars, developers are from Venus*
Digital products and services look better than ever, interfaces are intuitive and easy to use. Behind the shiny facades, designers and developers are working hand in hand to guarantee a great user experience. Both are responsible for the final product, and thus their relationship is put to the test. Colors are open to dispute, frameworks too, as long as that happens in an agile and pixel-perfect way.

This talk examines the relationship between designers and developers within work environments. It's an attempt to raise empathy and respect for each other’s roles and perspectives.

*Data (Science) in Physical Sciences*
Data science is the hot topic of the moment, mainly focussing on specific software and tools to implement machine learning algorithms quickly and optimise customer experience or sales. Physical sciences on the other hand, have long been relying on scrutinising data analysis and modelling to understand the underlying factors and the physical processes.

The talk will focus on a couple of projects:
• Statistical modelling of the unknown mass of a galaxy, through a Markov Chain Monte Carlo algorithm.
• Global warming simulations based on greenhouse gases.

About the speakers:
*Sonja Heinen*
Sonja is a visual designer and autodidactic developer, interested in the space where technology, art and society collide.
She earned a BA in Communications Design and a MA in Sustainable Design from Kingston University in London, then relocated to Berlin.
At the moment she works as a creative consultant for INNOQ and plays with Frontend technologies.

*Uğur Ural*
Uğur is a data scientist at Climate Analytics, doing quantitative analysis of climate policies and running global warming simulations based on anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions. She has a PhD in astrophysics from the University of Leicester and used to analyse, model and simulate data from galaxies before switching fields.
how_to_find_us: The entrance is inside the courtyard – the BCG Digital Ventures sign is visible as entering the courtyard from Dircksenstraße. The venue is on the first floor to the right of the staircase and elevator.
name: Talk Night at BCG Digital Ventures

description:
This is a whole day hands-on workshop happening on June 2nd in Cologne / Germany and will be broadcasted online.

• What we'll do

First you'll learn how to deploy a production ready upstream Kubernetes or OpenShift Origin Cluster on either Bare-Metal servers, AWS, Azure, GCP or OpenStack with the open source tool TK8.

After the initial deployment, we'll cover Kubernetes fundamentals deeply and provide a bunch of best practices to run your applications on top of your federated Kubernetes Cluster.

• What to bring
Please bring your laptop and your favourite cloud with you.

• How to join?

http://bit.ly/cka_kubernauts
name: The easy way to Hybrid Kubernetes on AWS, Azure, GCP, OpenStack and Bare-Metal
